meanings.definition: One who leases property or equipment.
meanings.sent1: The leaser signed a contract to rent the apartment for a year.
meanings.sent2: The leaser owns several buildings that he rents out to businesses.
meanings.sent3: The leaser accidentally locked himself out of the rental property.
meanings.sent4: The leaser of the car was like a temporary owner, enjoying its benefits.
meanings.sent5: The leaser carefully inspects the equipment before agreeing to the lease.

meanings.definition: A person or company that rents out property to others.
meanings.sent1: The leaser collected the monthly rent from the tenants.
meanings.sent2: The leaser decided to renovate the house before putting it up for rent.
meanings.sent3: The leaser joked that being a landlord was like playing a real-life game of Monopoly.
meanings.sent4: The leaser's properties were like puzzle pieces, fitting perfectly into the rental market.
meanings.sent5: The leaser always ensures the rental agreements are fair and clear for both parties involved.
